intro: Orthotactus pohlianus, commonly known as the Pohli's orthotactus, is a small, perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Central Asia. It typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has a basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowering stems bear small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish or brownish in color. Orthotactus pohlianus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
